title: Google is exploring the idea of its own Galaxy Z Flip 4 foldable
description: Google is "definitely looking" at other types of foldables, so we might one day get a Google Pixel Flip.

title: Carl Pei wants to make something out of Nothing, but carefully
description: A quick chat with Nothing's CEO about the company, the smartphone market, and what the Nothing Phone 2 might be.

title: Ransomware threats are growing, and targeting Microsoft devices more and more
description: Hackers are exploiting thousands of flaws found in more than a hundred different products.

title: The Motorola Razr 2023 could run full apps and a keyboard on its cover display
description: The Razr 2023 would appear to be coming with a cover screen that improves over what its rivals offer.

title: Are air fryers toxic? We weigh up the facts
description: We look into whether or not air fryers are toxic, to give you our expert opinion.

title: Windows 11 suffers from a weird bug that messes with SATA SSDs and hard drives
description: Microsoft admits that an odd glitch that causes internal drives to be detected as external ones also affects Windows 11.

title: These fake ChatGPT apps are just here to scam you out of your money
description: ChatGPT is free and doesn't yet come as a mobile app, many people are paying hundreds of dollars in yearly subscriptions, experts warn.

title: Quordle today - hints and answers for Saturday, May 20 (game #481)
description: Looking for Quordle clues? We can help. Plus get the answers to Quordle today and past solutions.

title: You can create affordable 3D prints up to 5x faster with Anycubic’s Kobra 2
description: Whether you’re planning your very first 3D project or you’re a professional with thousands of prints under your belt who would like to upgrade your gear  you will inevitably want a high speed 3D printer that can provide high quality results without breaking the bank. Say hello to the Anycubic Kobra 2, a professional quality FDM printer launching at an affordable $269.
